/blog/post/2025/04/02/react-native-skia-.title: Creating Stunning Gradients in React Native with Skia
/blog/post/2025/04/02/react-native-skia-.description: Learn how to create stunning text with React Native using React Native Skia. In this post, we’ll explore how to leverage Skia’s powerful features to bring vibrant gradients to life.

/blog/post/2025/03/17/locale-ios-app-dev.title: Which Locale? Decoding the Madness Behind iOS Localization and Language Preferences
/blog/post/2025/03/17/locale-ios-app-dev.description: iOS localization is a wild ride where device and app locales play by their own rules. But don’t worry, after some chaos, Apple’s settings actually matched our expectations. Of course, only after a few twists and turns.

/blog/post/2025/03/01/llm.title: Large Language Models (LLMs): a hitchhiker's guide to their galaxy (for newbies like me)
/blog/post/2025/03/01/llm.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) are revolutionizing how we interact with technology. This article provides some entry level knowledge about them. A personal selection of topic needed to understand the basics of them.

/blog/post/2025/01/03/styled-component-t.title: Styled Components: create a type to define transient props based on the props interface of another component
/blog/post/2025/01/03/styled-component-t.description: Standard transient props and shouldForwardProp are styled components API let you filter out props that  should not be passed to the underlying React node or DOM element. In this post we will see how we can create a type  to automatically define props from the interface of props of a parent component.

/blog/post/2024/12/31/carousel-parallax-.title: Create a circular carousel with parallax effect in React Native
/blog/post/2024/12/31/carousel-parallax-.description: Let's see how it is possible to create a circular carousel with parallax effect in React Native by  leveraging the power of React Native Reanimated.

/blog/post/2024/10/21/react-universe-202.title: React Universe 2024
/blog/post/2024/10/21/react-universe-202.description: Let's dive into the talks from React Universe 2024 that stood out to us the most and share the key  insights we gained. From innovative debugging tools to cross-platform development strategies, we’ll walk you through what we found valuable and how it’s shaping our approach to React and React Native development.

/blog/post/2024/03/02/react-native-skia-.title: React Native is Native: drawing customized background shapes with React Native Skia and React Native SVG
/blog/post/2024/03/02/react-native-skia-.description: A lot of mobile developer often complains that React Native is not Native, because it is missing some  features. This is absolutely not true! In this blog post I will show you how I create a component with a custom  background shape, similar to the one I did for a native component ome time ago

/blog/post/2024/01/31/advent-of-typescri.title: Advent of TypeScript 2023: Santa is stuck! (Day 24)
/blog/post/2024/01/31/advent-of-typescri.description: Santa is stuck! Let's see how I helped him to escape from the maze using the TypeScript type system.

/blog/post/2024/01/20/advent-of-typescri.title: Advent of TypeScript 2023: Connect 4 (Day 23)
/blog/post/2024/01/20/advent-of-typescri.description: Connect 4, a classical family Christmas game. Let's see how to tackle it with the typescript type system.

/blog/post/2024/01/04/advent-of-typescri.title: Advent of TypeScript 2023: Tic tac toe (Day 21)
/blog/post/2024/01/04/advent-of-typescri.description: Tic tac toe, another classical kata games you can find at a coding dojo. A game that is simple to implement with  functions, variables etc. becomes a real challenge when you try to implement it using only types.

/blog/post/2023/12/30/advent-of-typescri.title: Advent of TypeScript 2023: Rock paper scissors (Day 17)
/blog/post/2023/12/30/advent-of-typescri.description: Rock paper scissors, one of the classical kata games you can find at a coding dojo. Can it be  implemented using only TypeScript types?

/blog/post/2023/12/29/advent-of-typescri.title: Advent of TypeScript 2023: my personal favourite challenges
/blog/post/2023/12/29/advent-of-typescri.description: This year I participated in the first edition of Advent of TypeScript created by TypeHero. In this  new series of article I will show my solutions to the challenges I liked the most.

/blog/post/2023/06/30/swiftui-text-conca.title: SwiftUI and the Text concatenations super powers
/blog/post/2023/06/30/swiftui-text-conca.description: Do you need a way to compose beautiful text with images and custom font like you are used with  Attributed String. The Text component has everything we need to create some sort of 'attributed text' directly in SwiftUI. Let's go!!!

/blog/post/2023/01/10/widget-ios-swiftui.title: Widget iOS: how to fix the image bundling problem
/blog/post/2023/01/10/widget-ios-swiftui.description: Discover how we had a long day debugging WidgetKit problems with images.

/blog/post/2022/10/03/swiftui-path-svg-s.title: Use SwiftUI Path and Shape to render your svg files: a practical example
/blog/post/2022/10/03/swiftui-path-svg-s.description: Let's have some fun with SwiftUI by drawing an inspiration title component leveraging Path and Shape.

/blog/post/2022/06/06/microfrontend-modu.title: Create a microfrontend app using module federation and dynamic configuration
/blog/post/2022/06/06/microfrontend-modu.description: We are used to the term microservice in the backend world. Is there a way to achieve the same architectural indipendence in the frontend world? Let's see how it is possible to create a microfrontend app by leveraging Webpack 5 module federation with a widget-based custom remote configuration.

/blog/post/2022/03/02/custom-jackson-mod.title: A custom module for Jackson object mapper using Java Service Provider
/blog/post/2022/03/02/custom-jackson-mod.description: Sometimes you have custom Jackson object mapper imported from external modules/libraries. How can you  customize their serialization/deserialization? Let's go to discover the power of Java Service Provider Interface.

/blog/post/2022/01/02/react-detect-scrol.title: A simple react hook to detect scroll direction
/blog/post/2022/01/02/react-detect-scrol.description: How do you detect scroll direction using React hooks? Let’s find out in this new post.

/blog/post/2021/11/05/contract-testing-a.title: Contract testing asynchronous messaging with Pact and MockK
/blog/post/2021/11/05/contract-testing-a.description: In the last weeks I worked with my colleague Felice Giovinazzo on a new feature for the refund  process. Let’s see how we used pact to test a message-based interaction between two microservices with Pact

/blog/post/2021/06/06/ddd-dictionary.title: A Domain Driven Design dictionary for newbies
/blog/post/2021/06/06/ddd-dictionary.description: In the last months, I started to hear a lot of stuff about Domain Driven Design. What is DDD? What does it try to solve? This is a post for all the newbies (like me) that are searching for a definition of what DDD is, which are its main parts and what is its main goal.

/blog/post/2021/05/31/swift-linux-test-l.title: How to test your Swift source code on Linux: locally and on Github Actions
/blog/post/2021/05/31/swift-linux-test-l.description: Quick tips (useful for open source projects) for testing your Swift source code on Linux locally  and with Github Actions.

/blog/post/2021/03/08/ios-test-multiple-.title: Better organize tests and run them against multiple configuration with Xcode Test Plan
/blog/post/2021/03/08/ios-test-multiple-.description: Recently I added a lot of Unit and UI tests to RangeUISlider, one of my open source projects. Let's see how I grouped them and run them against multiple configurations with Xcode Test Plan.

/blog/post/2021/01/27/kotlin-junit5-mock.title: Unit testing in Kotlin with JUnit 5 and MockK
/blog/post/2021/01/27/kotlin-junit5-mock.description: I recently discovered MockK, a mocking library created for Kotlin. Let's see how it is possible to write modern unit tests with MockK + JUnit 5.

/blog/post/2020/12/23/rest-template-webc.title: Spring Boot + Kotlin Rest client cheatsheet: RestTemplate and Webclient
/blog/post/2020/12/23/rest-template-webc.description: During the last months I worked a lot with Spring Boot backend applications. In this post I explain how you can consume a REST api from a Spring Boot application using RestTemplate and (the new) WebClient.

/blog/post/2020/10/19/swift-package-mana.title: Swift Package Manager: bundling resources with a Swift Package
/blog/post/2020/10/19/swift-package-mana.description: Recently I upgraded my ID3TagEditor swift package to the latest Swift tools version (5.3). During the upgraded I discovered that now you can bundle resources with your Swift package. In this post I will show you how  you can do this, and also an interesting trick in order to be able to build a project as a Swift Package and as a standard project from Xcode.

/blog/post/2020/08/07/webpack-workbox-se.title: Create a service worker with Workbox, Webpack and TypeScript
/blog/post/2020/08/07/webpack-workbox-se.description: Recently I migrated my website to Webpack and TypeScript. I decided also to give a try to Workbox, a set of Google libraries to improve the creation of a Progressive Web App. Let's see how easy it is to create a PWA with this tools.

/blog/post/2020/07/02/expose-uikit-to-sw.title: Use UIKit components in SwiftUI: UIViewControllerRepresentable and UIViewRepresentable
/blog/post/2020/07/02/expose-uikit-to-sw.description: Do you know that it is possible to use UKit components in SwiftUI? Let's see how you can use UIViewRepresentable and UIViewControllerRepresentable to use your UIKit based component or to fill the gap for missing SwiftUI API.

/blog/post/2020/06/02/dynamic-imports-we.title: Lazy loading of JavaScript modules by using dynamic imports and code splitting with Webpack
/blog/post/2020/06/02/dynamic-imports-we.description: Most of the time you have a big JavaScript codebase for your website but you need only a small fraction of it when a page is requested. Is it possible to load chunks of JavaScript code only when they are really needed? Yes you can with Webpack and its code splitting feature based on a syntax equal to the one of ES2020 dynamic imports.

/blog/post/2020/05/20/dark-mode-css-sass.title: Add dark mode support on your website with SASS and prefers-color-scheme media query
/blog/post/2020/05/20/dark-mode-css-sass.description: Dark mode support has been around for quite some time. Let's see how you can create a light theme and a dark theme for your website that will be selected automatically based on the user system preference.

/blog/post/2020/04/19/dependecy-injectio.title: How to: create your SUPER simple dependency injector container in Swift
/blog/post/2020/04/19/dependecy-injectio.description: There are a lot of dependency injection framework in the open source swift world with really cool features like object graph, persistence etc. But what if all you need is a lightweight dependencies container? In this post I will show you how to create it by leveraging the Metatype Type, Generics, the Hashable protocol and the Equatable protocol.

/blog/post/2020/03/06/custom-tabbar-swif.title: Create a custom TabBar in SwiftUI
/blog/post/2020/03/06/custom-tabbar-swif.description: SwiftUI has been introduced by Apple during the last WWDC. I started to use it for a personal project to understand its potential. Let's see how I used SwiftUI to create a custom TabBar with modal and detail navigation.

/blog/post/2020/01/18/react-native-activ.title: How to: enable Hermes JavaScript engine in your React Native app

/blog/post/2019/12/15/pwa-offiline-track.description: PWA offer great native alike offline capabilities. But what about tracking? In this tutorial I will show you how simple it is to implement offline tracking with Google Analytics in your PWA.

/blog/post/2019/11/16/pull-to-refresh-we.description: Implementing a pull to refresh component in vanilla js for your progressive web app (PWA) it's really easy. Let's do it now!

/blog/post/2017/05/12/github-pages-jekyl.title: Github Pages and Jekyll: chicio coding birth
/blog/post/2017/05/12/github-pages-jekyl.description: So, how was created this blog? Let's go through the development process of its creation. Boring and fun at the same time.
